teucer: <entryFree id="n48038" type="main" key="Teucer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucer</orth>, <itype>cri</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Teucrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*teu=kros.</foreign> <sense id="n48038.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Telamon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Salamis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Ajax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 24</bibl>; 4, 9, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 698</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48038.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Scamander of Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son-in-law of Dardanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards king of Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 705</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 108</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48038.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teu-crus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Teu cer;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf. for <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 345</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Trojans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 248</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 705</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 728 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:348" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 348</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48038.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teu-crĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <trans><tr>of Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:36" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 36</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48038.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Trojan country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48038.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n48038.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan female.</hi> captivae, Sabin. 1, 81.—</sense><sense id="n48038.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A pseudonymic designation of some person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teucris illa lentum sane negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teuchites: <entryFree id="n48039" type="greek" key="teuchi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">teuchītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teuxi/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fragrant rush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 72, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teucri: <entryFree id="n48040" type="main" key="Teucri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Teucer, II. 1. and 2. b.</entryFree>
teucrion: <entryFree id="n48041" type="greek" key="teucri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">teucrĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teu/krion.</foreign> <sense id="n48041.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the germander</hi>: Teucrium chamaedrys, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl> (al. Teucria).—</sense><sense id="n48041.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The herb spleenwort</hi>: Teucrium flavium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 20, § 45</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">teucrĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 19, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teucris: <entryFree id="n48042" type="main" key="Teucris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucris</orth>, ĭdis; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Teucer.</entryFree>
teus: <entryFree id="n48043" type="main" key="Te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v Teos.</entryFree>
teuta: <entryFree id="n48044" type="main" key="Teuta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a queen of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 11, § 24</bibl>. — Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutāna</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutani: <entryFree id="n48045" type="main" key="Teuta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of the Peloponnesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutates: <entryFree id="n48046" type="main" key="Teuta_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity of the Gauls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom human sacrifices were offered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 445</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teuthalis: <entryFree id="n48047" type="greek" key="teutha^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">teuthălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teuqali/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> sanguinaria <hi rend="ital">and</hi> polygonos. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teuthras: <entryFree id="n48048" type="main" key="Teuthras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuthras</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*teu/qras.</foreign> <sense id="n48048.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Thespius</hi>, Hyg. <cb n="TEXT" /> Fab. 99 and 100.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48048.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuthran-tēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Teuthras;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Mysian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 243</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48048.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuthrantĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Teuthras</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans><tr>the daughters of Thespius</tr>, <tr>a son of Teuthras</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48048.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuthrānĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Teu-thrānĭē</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the territory in Mysia ruled by Teuthras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 85, 87, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 30, 33, § 125</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n48048.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Campania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48048.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 402</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teuticus: <entryFree id="n48049" type="main" key="Teuti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Illyrian chief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutobodiaci: <entryFree id="n48050" type="main" key="Teutobodiaci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutobodiaci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Galatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutoburgiensis: <entryFree id="n48051" type="main" key="Teutoburgiensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutoburgiensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the citadel of the Teutones</hi>: saltus, <hi rend="ital">a forest of Western Germany in which Varus was defeated</hi> A. D. 9, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutomatus: <entryFree id="n48052" type="main" key="Teutomatus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutomatus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Nitiobriges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutoni: <entryFree id="n48053" type="main" key="Teuto^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutŏni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutŏ-nes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 67" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 5, 1 sq.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Teutons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:7" default="NO">3, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:20:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 20, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:66 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 66 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cantaber exiguis aut longis Teutonus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 259</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Teutonic;</hi> or, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Germanic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">German</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 44: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 406</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
teutria: <entryFree id="n48054" type="main" key="Teutri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ionian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
texo: <entryFree id="n48055" type="main" key="texo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">texo</orth>, <itype>xui, xtum</itype> (<sense id="n48055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragog. texier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 69</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root tek-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/tekon, ti/ktw,</foreign> to beget; Sanscr. takman, child; taksh, to make</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to weave</hi> (class.; syn. neo). </sense><sense id="n48055.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">texens telam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegumenta corporum vel texta vel suta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in araneolis aliae quasi rete texunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuem texens sublimis aranea telam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vacuo texetur aranea lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 33: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamydem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:499" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 499</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48055.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fit together</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interlace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intertwine; to construct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rubeā texatur fiscina virgā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molle feretrum texunt virgis et vimine querno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietem lento vimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:262" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 262</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">domum vimine querno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:583" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 583</bibl></cit>. saepes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 371</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:45" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 36; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam rosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:51:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varios flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundinibus textae casae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia ex papyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basilicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robore naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundine texta hibernacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: pyram pinu aridā, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 846: <cit><quote lang="la">Labyrinthus Parietibus textum caecis iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 589</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48055.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ea tela texitur et ea incitatur in civitate ratio vivendi, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>is devised</tr>, <tr>contrived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 226</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amor patriae Quod tua texuerunt scripta retexit opus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had wrought</tr>, <tr>produced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam sermones possunt longi texier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulas cottidianis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opus luculente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">textum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is woven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a web</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n48055.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretiosa texta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illita texta veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 640</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pepli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48055.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which is plaited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braided</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fitted together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">texture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinea carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 524</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 531</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:506" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 506</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enarrabile clipei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1052" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1052</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">talia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lolliam vidi, zmaragdis margaritisque opertam, alterno texto fulgentibus toto capite,</quote> <trans><tr>in alternate structures</tr>, <tr>layers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 117</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n48055.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of literary composition, <hi rend="ital">tissue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">texture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi textum tenue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
textilis: <entryFree id="n48056" type="main" key="texti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>texo</etym>, <sense id="n48056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrought</hi>, <cb n="THAL" /> <hi rend="ital">textile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48056.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.) </sense><sense id="n48056.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stragulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 372" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernacula textilibus signis adornata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 4.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: pestis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a garment steeped in poison</hi>, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20: induere nuptam ventum textilem, i.e. <hi rend="ital">a very thin garment</hi>, Petr 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> — </sense><sense id="n48056.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">textĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. opus), <hi rend="ital">a web</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piece of cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canvas</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nego ullam picturam in textili (fuisse), quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">textile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 18, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 22</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48056.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">plaited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interwoven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intertwined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constructed</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <trans><tr>garlands of roses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:80:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 80, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pileus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
textor: <entryFree id="n48057" type="main" key="textor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>texo</etym>, <sense id="n48057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weaver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:59:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 59, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">textorum et textricum cibaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
textorius: <entryFree id="n48058" type="main" key="texto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to weaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaiting</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">braiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">textorial</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n48058.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvearia opere textorio salicibus connectentur,</quote> <trans><tr>plaited work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48058.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">textorium, inquis, totum mehercule istud est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>entangled</tr>, <tr>entangling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
textricula: <entryFree id="n48059" type="hapax" key="textri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>textrix</etym>, <sense id="n48059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> (female) <hi rend="ital">weaver;</hi> in apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
textrinus: <entryFree id="n48060" type="main" key="textri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textrīnus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from textorinus, from textor</etym>. <sense id="n48060.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to weaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">textrine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48060.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: ars, <hi rend="ital">the art of weaving</hi>, Firm. Error. Prof. Relig. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 2, 19</bibl></cit>. — More freq., </sense><sense id="n48060.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48060.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">textrīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. opus), <hi rend="ital">weaving</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 46, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Collect.: juxta vehiculi frontem omne textrinum incedit ( = omnes textores),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48060.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">textrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. officina), <hi rend="ital">a weaver</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s shop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor 2, p. 346, 35</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n48060.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to construction; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">textrīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ship-yard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dock-yard.</hi> idem campus habet textrinum navibus longis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 326</bibl> (Ann. v 468 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
textrix: <entryFree id="n48061" type="main" key="textrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>textor</etym>, <sense id="n48061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female weaver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:19:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 19, 1</bibl>; Inscr. Rein. cl. 9, n. 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:65" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 25</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In apposition: anus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Fates</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
textum: <entryFree id="n48062" type="main" key="textum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. texo <sense id="n48062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
textura: <entryFree id="n48063" type="main" key="textu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>texo</etym>, <sense id="n48063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a web</hi>, <hi rend="ital">texture</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n48063.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aranearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48063.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a construction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tenui constet texturā (animi natura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 209</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 777</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
textus: <entryFree id="n48064" type="main" key="textus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of texo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48065" type="main" key="textus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">textus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>texo, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n48065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">texture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tissue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n48065.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt tenuia textu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capiuntur purpurae parvulis rarique textu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48065.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of language, <hi rend="ital">construction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">context</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:57" default="NO">8, 6, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem brevi textu percurram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ostendit textus superior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod contra foederum textum juvarentur Armeniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 270</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thabena: <entryFree id="n48066" type="main" key="Thabe_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thabēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Numidia</hi>, Auct. B. Afr 77; its inhabitants are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thabēnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 77</bibl></sense></entryFree>
thabraca: <entryFree id="n48067" type="main" key="Thabraca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thabraca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Numidia on the coast of the Mediterranean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Juv 10, 194,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 3, 2, § 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thais: <entryFree id="n48068" type="main" key="Tha_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thāis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qai/+s,</foreign> <sense id="n48068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated courtesan of Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO">4</bibl> (5), 5, 43; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 604</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 383 sq.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n48068.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another at Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:12" default="NO">4, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48068.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A courtesan in the Eunuchus of Terence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thala: <entryFree id="n48069" type="main" key="Thala"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thala</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qa/la,</foreign> <sense id="n48069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an important town of Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thalamegus: <entryFree id="n48070" type="greek" key="tha^la^me_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălămēgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qalamhgo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a state-barge fitted up with cabins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl> (called navis cubiculata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 20, 3</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
thalamus: <entryFree id="n48071" type="greek" key="tha^la^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qa/lamos,</foreign> <sense id="n48071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inner room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chamber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apartment</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n48071.1" n="I" level="1"> Lit <pb n="1866" /> <cb n="THAM" /> </sense><sense id="n48071.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pars secreta domus ... Tres habuit thalamos, quorum tu, Pandrose, dextrum, Aglauros laevum, medium possederat Herse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreique Eumenidum thalami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 280</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">delubra ei gemina, quae vocant thalamos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 46, 71, § 185</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of bees: ubi jam thalamis se conposuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 189</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48071.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a sleeping-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedchamber</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum, dormitorium, cubile),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 623</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 456</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:57 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 57 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48071.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48071.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A marriage - bed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bridal-bed</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus, conjugium, conubium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit> (3, 7), 14; 3, 7 (4, 6), 49; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 26</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48071.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wedlock</hi> (very freq. both in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalami expers vitam Degere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 550</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si non pertaesum thalami taedaeque fuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in conubio natae thalamoque moratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 253</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 388</bibl>; 9, 594; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 267</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 571</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:463 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 463 al.</bibl> — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamos ne desere pactos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 649</bibl></cit>; Ov M. 1, 658; 7, 22; 12, 193; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 689</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:63:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 63, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 256" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 256</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:992" default="NO">992</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:226" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 226</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thalassa: <entryFree id="n48072" type="main" key="Tha^lassa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thălassa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qa/lassa</foreign> (the sea), <sense id="n48072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of the ninth book of Apicius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which treats of sea-fish.</hi></sense></entryFree>
thalassegle: <entryFree id="n48073" type="greek" key="tha^lasse_gle_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălassēglē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> potamantis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thalassicus: <entryFree id="n48074" type="greek" key="tha^lassi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălassĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qalassiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colos (pallioli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 67</bibl></cit>; v. thalassinus.</sense></entryFree>
thalassinus: <entryFree id="n48075" type="greek" key="tha^lassi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălassĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qala/ssinos,</foreign> <sense id="n48075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sea-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1127</bibl></cit>; cf. thalassicus.</sense></entryFree>
thalassion: <entryFree id="n48076" type="greek" key="tha^lassi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălassĭon phȳcos</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">qala/ssion fu=kos</foreign>, <sense id="n48076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">archil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">orchil</hi> (a sea-plant which produces a reddish dye): Lichen roccella, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 66, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thalassites: <entryFree id="n48077" type="greek" key="tha^lassi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălassītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qalassi/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sea-wine</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wine which has been ripened by sinking it in the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 8, 10, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thalassomeli: <entryFree id="n48078" type="greek" key="tha^lasso^me^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălassŏmĕli</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qalasso/meli,</foreign> <sense id="n48078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sea-water mixed with honey</hi>, used as a beverage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 35, § 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 28, 537</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thalea: <entryFree id="n48079" type="gloss" key="Tha^le_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thălēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Thalia <sense id="n48079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
thales: <entryFree id="n48080" type="main" key="Tha^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thăles</orth>, <itype>is and lētis</itype> (<sense id="n48080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Thaletis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; Juv 13, 184; <case>dat.</case> Thaleti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, ext. 7), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qalh=s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek philosopher of Miletus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven wise men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the Ionic sect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 19, 4</bibl>; Aug. Civ Dei, 18, 25.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Thalis, Prob. Cath. 1466 P.: <cit><quote lang="la">Thaletis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:184" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 184</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> Thali, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4</bibl>, n. 18: <cit><quote lang="la">Thaleti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, ext. 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2</bibl>, n. 9; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 25; 18, 37.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Thalem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4</bibl>, n. 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 14, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thalen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thaleta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 4, 363</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 382</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thaletem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 241</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Thale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 91</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thălētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dogmata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thalia: <entryFree id="n48081" type="main" key="Tha^li_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thălīa</orth> (written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thălēa</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl> Müll., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 6, 2</bibl>; so Rib.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qa/leia.</foreign> <sense id="n48081.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Muses; the Muse of Comedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 264</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Lyric poetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48081.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Graces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:3:10" default="NO">1, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48081.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-nymph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 826</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thaliarchus: <entryFree id="n48082" type="main" key="Tha^li^archus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thălĭarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qali/arxos,</foreign> <sense id="n48082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name given by Horace to the friend</hi> to whom is addressed C. 1, 9.</sense></entryFree>
thalictrum: <entryFree id="n48083" type="greek" key="tha^lictrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thălictrum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">thălitruum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meadow-rue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 112, § 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thalli: <entryFree id="n48084" type="main" key="Thalli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thalli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 5, 5, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thallumetus: <entryFree id="n48085" type="main" key="Thallume_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thallumētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave of Atticus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thallus: <entryFree id="n48086" type="greek" key="thallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qallo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a green stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green bough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cepae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 4</bibl>: Amyclaeus, perh. <hi rend="ital">a myrtlebough</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 376</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 14, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thalna: <entryFree id="n48087" type="main" key="Thalna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thalna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname of the Juventian</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thamnum: <entryFree id="n48088" type="main" key="thamnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thamnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. thannum.</entryFree>
thamyras: <entryFree id="n48089" type="main" key="Tha^my^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thămyras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian poet</hi> <cb n="THEA" /> <hi rend="ital">who entered into a contest with the Muses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">being vanquished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was deprived of his eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22</bibl> (3, 15), 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 399</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl>.—Called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thămyris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:183" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thannum: <entryFree id="n48090" type="greek" key="thannum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thannum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thamnum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qa/mnos,</foreign> <sense id="n48090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrub</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thapsacus: <entryFree id="n48091" type="main" key="Thapsa^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thapsăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qa/yakos,</foreign> <sense id="n48091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Euphrates</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">El-Hammam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thapsia: <entryFree id="n48092" type="greek" key="thapsi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thapsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qayi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poisonous shrub</hi>: Thapsia Asclepium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 124</bibl>.—Called <orth extent="full" lang="la">thapsos</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 919</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thapsus: <entryFree id="n48093" type="main" key="Thapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thapsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qa/yos.</foreign> <sense id="n48093.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A peninsula and city in Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Magnisi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 477</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 689</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:206" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 206</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48093.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Africa Propria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed for Cæsar</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s victory over the partisans of Pompey</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Baltah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 48</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 28, 1; 44, 1; 46, 4; 79, 3; 80, 2.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thapsĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Thapsus</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 97, 2.</sense></entryFree>
thasus: <entryFree id="n48094" type="main" key="Tha^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thăsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qa/sos,</foreign> <sense id="n48094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the north of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">off the coast of Thrace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Thaso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 54, 68</bibl>; Liv 33, 30; 33, 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 92 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thăsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thasus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thasian</hi>: nuces, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 90</bibl>: vinum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 14, 16, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thaumaci: <entryFree id="n48095" type="main" key="Thauma^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thaumăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Thessaly</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Dhomoko</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 14, 12</bibl>; inhabiting the town called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thaumăcĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen></sense></entryFree>
thaumas: <entryFree id="n48096" type="main" key="Thaumas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thaumas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qau/mas,</foreign> <sense id="n48096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Iris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48096.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thaumantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thaumas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thaumantian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Iris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 845</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48096.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thauman-tĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Thaumas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 480</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also simply Thaumantias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:115" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48096.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thau-mantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Thaumas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 647</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
theamedes: <entryFree id="n48097" type="main" key="theame_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">theamēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Ethiopian stone that repels iron;</hi> acc. to some, the <hi rend="ital">tourmaline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theangelis: <entryFree id="n48098" type="main" key="theangelis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">theangelis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of plant growing on Libanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theatralis: <entryFree id="n48099" type="main" key="the^a_tra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕātrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>theatrum</etym>, <sense id="n48099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theatrical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrales gladiatoriique consessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lascivia populi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad theatrales artes degeneravisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>concerning the order of sitting in the theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 2, 8, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>feigned</tr>, <tr>spurious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>low</tr>, <tr>vulgar</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes (montes) theatrali modo inflexi,</quote> <trans><tr>in the form of a theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
theatricus: <entryFree id="n48100" type="greek" key="the^a_tri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕātrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeatriko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theatric</hi> (late Lat. for the class. theatralis): <cit><quote lang="la">nugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chabr. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chabr. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudines, id. Civ. Dei, 6, 6: operarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mus. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
theatrum: <entryFree id="n48101" type="greek" key="the^a_trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕātrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qe/atron,</foreign> <sense id="n48101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a playhouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theatre</hi> (cf.: scena, spectaculum, ludus). </sense><sense id="n48101.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num theatrum, gymnasia, porticus, etc. ... rem publicam efficiebat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum ut commune sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra munita ... alterā (ex parte) a theatro, quod est ante oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi sensus maxime theatro et spectaculis perspectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid totius theatri clamore dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consessus theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vacuo laetus sessor plausorque theatro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 497</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos arto stipata theatro Spectat Roma potens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus in acie tutior quam in theatro fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 427</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exeamus e theatro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cease to speak of actors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>.—Of the Greek theatre, which served as a place for public meetings, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48101.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48101.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">any open space for exhibiting martial</hi> <cb n="THEC" /> <hi rend="ital">games</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 288</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 664</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48101.4" n="2" level="3"> Like our <hi rend="ital">theatre</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">the spectators assembled in a theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a theatrical audience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensus theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc est commovendum theatrum, cum ventum est ad ipsum illud Plaudite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (modi) totis theatris maestitiam inferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota saepe theatra exclamasse barbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spissa theatra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48101.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place of exhibition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stage</hi>, for any public act: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum theatrum virtuti conscientia majus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno theatro (ea familiaritas) spectata est,</quote> <trans><tr>openly</tr>, <tr>publicly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi in aliquo terrarum orbis theatro versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in theatro terrarum orbis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus quisque praeceptor frequentiā gaudet ac majore se theatro dignum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thebae: <entryFree id="n48102" type="main" key="The_bae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēbae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:6" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 60</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qh=bai</foreign> (or <foreign lang="greek">*qh/bh</foreign>), <sense id="n48102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of several cities of antiquity.</hi>—The most considerable were, </sense><sense id="n48102.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The city of the hundred gates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Upper Egypt</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Karnak</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:58" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 7, 11, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:60" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 8, 12, § 60</bibl>; 36, 13, 20, § 94 al.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48102.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēbae-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Thebaid</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 1, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48102.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēbāĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 51, § 97</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also simply Thebaicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 8, 13, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:157" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 22, 43, § 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Nigr. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48102.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thē-bāïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra), <hi rend="ital">the Thebaid</hi>, the capital of which was Thebes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 21, 46, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 4, 9, § 47 al.</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n48102.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The chief city of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the most ancient cities in Greece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by Cadmus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Thive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 19, 17, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:109" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 29, 30, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:50:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 50, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 74</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48102.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēbānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit> (4, 17), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thebes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Eteocles and Polynices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:50" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, Thebani fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <trans><tr>their sister Antigone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Niobe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:711" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pindaric</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aenigma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Theban Sphinx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:91:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 91, 9</bibl></cit> et saep. —<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēbāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the innabitants of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Thebans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl>;
