<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48184.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thessălĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48184.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thessălĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tempe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 92, § 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:219" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Argo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 120" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the chariot of Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="THEU" /> 30: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the battle of Pharsalia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 808</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48184.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thessălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tempe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 222</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thessaly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 30: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>in the camp of Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:278" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 24, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">philtra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:610" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 45</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thes-sălī</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Thessalians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48184.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thes-sălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Protesilaus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 10</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> (female) <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:565" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 565</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 190</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thessalonica: <entryFree id="n48185" type="main" key="Thessa^lo^ni_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thessălŏnīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qessaloni/kh,</foreign> <sense id="n48185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Sinus Thermaicus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Saloniki</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 27 al.</bibl> — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thessălŏnīcenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Thessalonica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thessalonice: <entryFree id="n48186" type="main" key="Thessa^lo^ni_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thessălŏnīcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Philip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Macedon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:13" default="NO">14, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:1" default="NO">16, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thessalus: <entryFree id="n48187" type="main" key="Thessa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thessălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Thessalia, C.</entryFree>
thestius: <entryFree id="n48188" type="main" key="Thesti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thestĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qe/stios,</foreign> <sense id="n48188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Ætolia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Leda and Althæa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of Plexippus and Toxeus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 77" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:155" default="NO">155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:174" default="NO">174</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48188.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thestĭă-des</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (male) <hi rend="ital">descendant of Thestius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Plexippus and Toxeus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 304</bibl></cit> and 434: <cit><quote lang="la">respice Thestiaden,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Meleager</tr>, <tr>son of Althæa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 305</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48188.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thestĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Thestius</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Althæa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 452</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thestor: <entryFree id="n48189" type="main" key="Thestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thestor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qe/stwr,</foreign> <sense id="n48189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of the soothsayer Calchas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 128" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 128</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thestŏrĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Thestor</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Calchas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 496</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theta: <entryFree id="n48190" type="greek" key="the_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thēta</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qh=ta,</foreign> <sense id="n48190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek letter</hi> <foreign lang="greek">q;</foreign> as the initial letter of the word <foreign lang="greek">qa/natos</foreign> (death), written by the Greeks upon their voting-tablets in sign of condemnation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:37:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 37, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 128</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 13</bibl>).—Upon Latin epitaphs, = OBIIT, MORTVVS EST, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4472 sq.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 610.—Appended to a passage as a critical mark of censure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 335</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thetidium: <entryFree id="n48191" type="main" key="The^ti^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕtĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeti/dion,</foreign> <sense id="n48191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6</bibl> and 7.</sense></entryFree>
thetis: <entryFree id="n48192" type="main" key="The^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis, or ĭdos</itype> (<case>abl.</case> also Theti; <sense id="n48192.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>; ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕlis</orth>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=87" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 87</bibl> Müll., or Trag. v. 431 Vahl.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui ut Thetin Thelim dicebant, sic Medicam Melicam vocabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qe/tis,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a sea-nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Nereus and Doris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Peleus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 54" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:244" default="NO">244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:221 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 221 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 400</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 6 al.</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Thetide, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 709</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48192.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, appel., <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">temptare Thetin ratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic summa levi stringitur Thetis vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapilli Thetidis,</quote> <trans><tr>pearls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; and, hyperbol., of <hi rend="ital">a large bath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:13:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 13, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theudoria: <entryFree id="n48193" type="main" key="Theudori^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Theudorĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Athamania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Thodhoriana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theuma: <entryFree id="n48194" type="main" key="Theuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Theuma</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
theumesus: <entryFree id="n48195" type="main" key="Theume_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Theumēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:372" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 372</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Theumēsius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>, amnis, i. e. Ismenus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:462" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 462</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis, i. e. Polynices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 331</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
theurgia: <entryFree id="n48196" type="greek" key="the^urgi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕurgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeourgi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a summoning of spirits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theurgy</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 9 and 10.</sense></entryFree>
theurgicus: <entryFree id="n48197" type="greek" key="the^urgi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕurgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeourgiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spirit-summoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theurgic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars, Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 10: consecratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 9</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1869" /> <cb n="THOR" /></sense></entryFree>
theurgus: <entryFree id="n48198" type="greek" key="the^urgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕurgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeourgo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who summons spirits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a magician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theurgist</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 10.</sense></entryFree>
thia: <entryFree id="n48199" type="main" key="Thi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qei/a.</foreign> <sense id="n48199.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Hyperion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Sol</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48199.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island near Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 87, 89, § 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thiasitas: <entryFree id="n48200" type="gloss" key="thi^a^si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĭăsĭtas</orth>, <itype>sodalitas</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=366" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 366</bibl> Müll. [thiasus.]</entryFree>
thiasus: <entryFree id="n48201" type="greek" key="thi^a^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĭăsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thyăsus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qi/asos,</foreign> <sense id="n48201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bacchic dance</hi>, a dance performed in honor of Bacchus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 581</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:41" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:253" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 253</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thiatis: <entryFree id="n48202" type="foreign" key="Thi^a^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĭătis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Egypt.</etym>, <sense id="n48202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of one of the Egyptian months</hi>, answering to <hi rend="ital">August</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 80, § 105</bibl> (al. Thoti).</sense></entryFree>
thibii: <entryFree id="n48203" type="main" key="Thibii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thibii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous people of Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thieldones: <entryFree id="n48204" type="foreign" key="thieldones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thieldones</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Span.</etym>, <sense id="n48204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of Spanish horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thimanli: <entryFree id="n48205" type="main" key="Thimanli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thimanli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thirmida: <entryFree id="n48206" type="main" key="Thirmida"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thirmida</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thisbe: <entryFree id="n48207" type="main" key="Thisbe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thisbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qi/sbh.</foreign> <sense id="n48207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little town on the coast of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its wild doves</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kakosia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:261" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 261</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 768</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">This-baeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thisbe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thisbæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 300</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48207.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A maiden beloved by Pyramus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:55 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 55 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
thlasias: <entryFree id="n48208" type="greek" key="thlasi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thlasĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qlasi/as</foreign> (the crushed), <sense id="n48208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one made a eunuch by bruising;</hi> called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">thlibĭas</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">qlibi/as</foreign> (the pressed), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:128" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:5" default="NO">48, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thlaspi: <entryFree id="n48209" type="greek" key="thlaspi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thlaspi</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qla/spi,</foreign> <sense id="n48209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 113, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 170" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thlibias: <entryFree id="n48210" type="main" key="thli_bi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thlībĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. thlasias.</entryFree>
thoas: <entryFree id="n48211" type="main" key="Tho^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thŏas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qo/as.</foreign> <sense id="n48211.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the</hi> Chersonesus Taurica, <hi rend="ital">under whom Iphigenia was priestess of the Tauric Diana; he was slain by Orestes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 66</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thŏantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thoas;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Tauric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:208" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 208</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:260" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 260</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:386" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 386</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48211.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Lemnos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Hypsipyle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by whom he was conveyed to Chios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when the women of Lemnos slew all the men there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 15" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 399</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:239 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 239 sq.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48211.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thŏantĭ-ăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Thoas</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hypsipyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 163</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48211.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thŏantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:650" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 650</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 700</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48211.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Ætolian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Andræmon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Greeks who besieged Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 262</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 81" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:97" default="NO">97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:114" default="NO">114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48211.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 415</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thocum: <entryFree id="n48212" type="main" key="tho_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thōcum</orth> <itype>genus sellae habetur apud Plautum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl> Müll. [ = <foreign lang="greek">qw=kos</foreign>].</entryFree>
tholus: <entryFree id="n48213" type="greek" key="tho^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qo/los,</foreign> <sense id="n48213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cupola</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rotunda</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fornix, testudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 448, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:282" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 282</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 296</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:59:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 59, 2</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In the tholi of the temple the votive gifts were suspended,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 408</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:734" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 2, 734</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:56" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thomix: <entryFree id="n48214" type="greek" key="tho_mix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thōmix</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">thōmex</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tōmex</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">tō-mix</orth>), <itype>icis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qw/mic,</foreign> <sense id="n48214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">string</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thread</hi>, Lucil. ap. Fest. pp. 356 and 357 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:32" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thoracatus: <entryFree id="n48215" type="main" key="tho_ra_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thōrācātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>thorax</etym>, <sense id="n48215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed with a breastplate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">corselet</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">navarchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigies Neronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thoraciculus: <entryFree id="n48216" type="main" key="tho_ra_ci^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thōrācĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<lbl>dim.</lbl> of thorax), <sense id="n48216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bust</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Laud. Virg. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thorax: <entryFree id="n48217" type="greek" key="tho_rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thōrax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (but <gen>f.</gen> Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 3, 3</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">qw/rac,</foreign> <sense id="n48217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the breast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorax.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48217.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in anatomy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48217.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48217.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armor</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">covering for the breast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a breastplate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corselet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cuirass; a doublet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stomacher</hi> (syn. lorica), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> thoracibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:87" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 87</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> thoracum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 260</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48217.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bust</hi>, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Goth. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thorius: <entryFree id="n48218" type="main" key="Tho^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; thus, Sp. Thorius Balbus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of the agrarian law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after him</hi>, Lex Thoria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 36, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 284</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Orell. Index Legg. s. h. v.—Another Thorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 6</bibl></cit>. <cb n="THRA" /></sense></entryFree>
thos: <entryFree id="n48219" type="greek" key="tho_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thōs</orth>, ōïs, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qw/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wolf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 34, 52, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:206" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 74, 95, § 206</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 253</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thoth: <entryFree id="n48220" type="foreign" key="Thoth"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thoth</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <etym>Egypt.</etym>, <sense id="n48220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Egyptian name of the fifth Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thraca: <entryFree id="n48221" type="main" key="Thra_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrācē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. Thracia.</entryFree>
thracia: <entryFree id="n48222" type="main" key="Thra_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrācĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qra/|kh,</foreign> <sense id="n48222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:1:5" default="NO">2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 162</bibl>.—Called also, after the Greek, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrācē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:257" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 11</bibl>; and, Latinized, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 335</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 13</bibl>; Cic. Fragm. ap. Serv. Verg. l. l. (but the Cod. palimps. Rep. 2, 4, 9, has in this passage Thracia).—After the Greek form <foreign lang="greek">*qrh/|kh,</foreign> also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 588</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n48222.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orpheus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, Thracius, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Orpheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:193" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Threcia Bacche,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n48222.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:201" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:6 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 12, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>—‡ </sense><sense id="n48222.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrā-cĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">BELLO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 172, 332</bibl></cit>.—In the Graecized collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēcĭcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: lingua, Capitol. Max. § 2. — </sense><sense id="n48222.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qrh/|kios,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Boreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orpheus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 645</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cithara,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit> (4, 1, 42): <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 659</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48222.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian;</hi> or, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thraces arant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:60" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 682</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 83</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48222.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of gladiator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called from his Thracian equipment;</hi> in this signif. the Graecized form Threx (also written Thraex) is the predom. one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4</bibl>, praef. 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 54; 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 43, 99, § 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2576</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 189, 434</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n48222.7" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēcĭdĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Thraec-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Threx</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Thracian gladiator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Threcidic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 45, § 129</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gladius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Caes. 18</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēcĭdĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. arma), <hi rend="ital">the arms of a Threx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48222.8" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēïssa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thressa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qrh/issa</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*qrh=|ssa,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Thracian;</hi> or, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpalyce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamisque tuis Threissa propinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:147" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thressa puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 100</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Chloe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caraeque Thressae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:132" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:165" default="NO">2, 165</bibl> and 239.</sense></entryFree>
thranis: <entryFree id="n48223" type="greek" key="thranis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thranis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qra/nis,</foreign> <sense id="n48223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> xiphias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thrascias: <entryFree id="n48224" type="greek" key="Thrasci^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrascĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qraski/as,</foreign> <sense id="n48224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the north-by-a-third-northwest wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thrasea: <entryFree id="n48225" type="main" key="Thrase^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrasĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name</hi>, esp. P. Thrasea Paetus, <hi rend="ital">a Stoic philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to death by Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 22, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thraso: <entryFree id="n48226" type="main" key="Thra^so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrăso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qra/swn.</foreign> <sense id="n48226.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a braggart soldier in Terence</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s Eunuch;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrăsōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Thrasonian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bragging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vainglorious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48226.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A friend of Hieronymus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thrasybulus: <entryFree id="n48227" type="main" key="Thra^sy^bu_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrăsybūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qrasu/boulos,</foreign> <sense id="n48227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the liberator of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his native city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the thirty tyrants.</hi> His life is written by Cornelius Nepos; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, ext. 4; 5, 6, ext. 2.</sense></entryFree>
thrasyllus: <entryFree id="n48228" type="main" key="Thra^syllus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrăsyllus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qra/sullos,</foreign> <sense id="n48228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the court astrologer of Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:576" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 576</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thrasymachus: <entryFree id="n48229" type="main" key="Thra^sy^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrăsymăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qrasu/maxos,</foreign> <sense id="n48229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Grecian sophist of Chalcedon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 32, 128</bibl>; id. Or. <cb n="THYA" /> 12, 39; 13, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:4" default="NO">3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:204" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 204</bibl> (where Ritschl, in Rhein. Mus. Neue Folge, 9, p. 480, reads Tharsymachi; many MSS. have Thresimachi).</sense></entryFree>
thrausi: <entryFree id="n48230" type="main" key="Thrausi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrausi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thrauston: <entryFree id="n48231" type="greek" key="thrauston"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thrauston</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qrausto/n,</foreign> <sense id="n48231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of</hi> metopion (gum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 23, 49, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thrax: <entryFree id="n48232" type="main" key="Thrax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, v. Thracia, E.</entryFree>
threce: <entryFree id="n48233" type="main" key="Thre_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. Thracia.</entryFree>
threcicus: <entryFree id="n48234" type="main" key="Thre_ci^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēcĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Thracia, C.</entryFree>
threcidicus: <entryFree id="n48235" type="main" key="Thre_ci^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēcĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Thracia, E. 2. b.</entryFree>
threicius: <entryFree id="n48236" type="main" key="Thre_i^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Thracia, D.</entryFree>
threissa: <entryFree id="n48237" type="main" key="Thre_issa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēïssa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thressa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Thracia, F.</entryFree>
threnus: <entryFree id="n48238" type="greek" key="thre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thrēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qrh=nos,</foreign> <sense id="n48238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a song of mourning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lamentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegy</hi> (syn. planctus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
threx: <entryFree id="n48239" type="main" key="Threx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Threx</orth>, <itype>ēcis</itype>, v. Thracia, E. 2.</entryFree>
thridax: <entryFree id="n48240" type="greek" key="thri^dax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thrĭdax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qri/dac,</foreign> <sense id="n48240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild lettuce</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 24, 448</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thrips: <entryFree id="n48241" type="greek" key="thrips"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thrips</orth>, <itype>ĭpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qri/y,</foreign> <sense id="n48241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wood-worm.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48241.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 41, 80, § 220</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48241.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless things</hi>, = quisquiliae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 164</bibl> (al. thriptes).</sense></entryFree>
thronium: <entryFree id="n48242" type="main" key="Thro^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrŏnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Locri Epicnemidii on the Boagrius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:37" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thronus: <entryFree id="n48243" type="greek" key="thro^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thrŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qro/nos,</foreign> <sense id="n48243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elevated seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a throne</hi> (syn. solium): <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 63</bibl></cit>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 10 praef.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. Pervig. Ven. 7: Thronos Caesaris,</quote> <trans><tr>one of the constellations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 71, § 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48243.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An angelic order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive throni, sive dominationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thryallis: <entryFree id="n48244" type="greek" key="thryallis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thryallis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qrualli/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two different plants.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48244.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> lychnitis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 74, § 121</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48244.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ear-shaped plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 61, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thucydides: <entryFree id="n48245" type="main" key="Thu_cy_di^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūcȳdĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qoukudi/dhs,</foreign> <sense id="n48245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 30 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">65, 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 287 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 73</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūcȳdĭdīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thucydides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thucydidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (orationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 16</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūcȳdĭdĭi</orth>, <itype>ŏrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">imitators of Thucydides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thule: <entryFree id="n48246" type="main" key="Thu_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūlē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Thȳlē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qou/lh</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*qu/lh,</foreign> <sense id="n48246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the extreme nortl of Europe;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">Iceland;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">Mainland</hi> (the largest of the Shetland lslands), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 75, 77, § 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 16, 30, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:220" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 34, 39, § 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thunnarius: <entryFree id="n48247" type="main" key="thunna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thunnārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thynn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>thunnus</etym>, <sense id="n48247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the tunny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tunny-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thunnus: <entryFree id="n48248" type="greek" key="thunnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thunnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thynnus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/nnos,</foreign> <sense id="n48248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tunny</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tunny - fish</hi>: Scomber thynnus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:44 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 44 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:98" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thuralis: <entryFree id="n48249" type="main" key="thu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thūrālis, thūrārĭus, thūrĕus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">thūrĭbŭlum</orth>, etc., v. tur-.</entryFree>
thuriae: <entryFree id="n48250" type="main" key="Thu_ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qoupi/ai,</foreign> <sense id="n48250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Calabria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Salentines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thurii: <entryFree id="n48251" type="main" key="Thu_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūrĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qou/rioi,</foreign> <sense id="n48251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Tarentine Gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built upon the site of the ancient Sybaris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 3</bibl> (and perh., also, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 3, 5</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 9</bibl>. — Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qou/rion,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 5</bibl> (Thurii, where, perh., Turiis should be read).— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thurii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thurine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Tull. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 21, 33, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl></cit>: sinus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Tarentine Gulf</hi>, upon which Thurii was situated, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ornytus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Thurii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Viscus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Thurinum,</quote> <trans><tr>into the Thurine territory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thūrīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Thurii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 15, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thus: <entryFree id="n48252" type="main" key="thu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thūs</orth>, <itype>thūris</itype>, v. tus.</entryFree>
thya: <entryFree id="n48253" type="greek" key="thy_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thȳa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">thȳia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">qui/+a,</foreign> <pb n="1870" /> <cb n="THYM" /> <sense id="n48253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek name for the citrus-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 16, 30, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl> (4, 6), 49.</sense></entryFree>
thyamis: <entryFree id="n48254" type="main" key="Thy^a^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyămis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qu/amis,</foreign> <sense id="n48254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Epirus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Calamas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyatira: <entryFree id="n48255" type="main" key="Thyati_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyatīra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qua/teira,</foreign> <sense id="n48255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Lydia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ak-hissar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 115</bibl>; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyatīra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 8, 7</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyatīrēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Thyatira</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thybris: <entryFree id="n48256" type="main" key="Thybris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thybris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Tiberis <sense id="n48256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
thyene: <entryFree id="n48257" type="main" key="Thy^e_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Hyades who nursed Jupiter and Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:711" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 711</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyestes: <entryFree id="n48258" type="main" key="Thy^estes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyestes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*que/sths,</foreign> <sense id="n48258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Pelops and brother of Atreus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who set before him for food the flesh of his own son; he was the father of Ægisthus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 88" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 16, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 8</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n48258.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyestēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thyestes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thyestean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mycenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 462</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:86" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more furere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n48258.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyestĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> (male) <hi rend="ital">offspring of Thyestes;</hi> said of <hi rend="ital">Ægisthus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 407</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyias: <entryFree id="n48259" type="main" key="Thy_ia^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳiăs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*quia/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*qua/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Bacchante</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:92" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 92</bibl>.—More freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳiădes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchantes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:514" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:791" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 791</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyinus: <entryFree id="n48260" type="main" key="thy_i^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thȳĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/i+nos,</foreign> <sense id="n48260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of the citrus-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 18, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyle: <entryFree id="n48261" type="main" key="Thy_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. Thule.</entryFree>
thymbra: <entryFree id="n48262" type="greek" key="thymbra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymbra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/mbra,</foreign> <sense id="n48262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savory</hi>: Satureia hortensis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:10:233" default="NO">9, 10, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48263" type="main" key="Thymbra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thymbra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thymbrē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qu/mbrh,</foreign> <sense id="n48263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl> (dub.; al. Cambre); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:22" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 22</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48263.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thym-braeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Thymbræan</hi>, an epithet of <hi rend="ital">Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 85</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n48263.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">thymbrae-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">another name for the</hi> sisymbrium silvestre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 91, § 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymela: <entryFree id="n48264" type="greek" key="thy^me^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qume/lh,</foreign> <sense id="n48264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elevation in the centre of the orchestra of a Greek theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the form of an altar</hi>, upon which stood the leader of the chorus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 7, 21; Inscr. Spon. Miscell. Ant. p. 148.</sense></entryFree>
thymelaea: <entryFree id="n48265" type="greek" key="thy^me^laea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕlaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qume/laia,</foreign> <sense id="n48265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the flax - leaved daphne</hi>: Daphne Gnidium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 35, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymele: <entryFree id="n48266" type="main" key="Thy^me^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thymĕlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated female dancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:197" default="NO">8, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymelicus: <entryFree id="n48267" type="greek" key="thy^me^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qumeliko/s.</foreign> <sense id="n48267.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> thymele or <hi rend="ital">to the orchestra;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">thy-mĕlĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">theatrical musicians</hi> (opp. scaenici, actors), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48267.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., = scaenicus, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the theatre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">choragium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 282</bibl></cit>: Thymelica obscenitas, Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin. — Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48267.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">thy-mĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an actor</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 7, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2589</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48267.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an actress</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 7, 5.</sense></entryFree>
