tillius: <entryFree id="n48349" type="main" key="Tilli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tillĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a senator and tribune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproached by Horace for rudeness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 107</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:30:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 30, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 83, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
timaeus: <entryFree id="n48350" type="main" key="Ti_maeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīmaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ti/maios.</foreign> <sense id="n48350.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek historian of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under Agathocles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:31:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 31, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48350.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Pythagorean philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Plato</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29</bibl>. 87; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">After him was named the Platonic dialogue Timaeus, which Cicero translated into Latin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl>; v. the fragment of this translation (Timaeus sive de Universo), Cic. ed. B. and K. vol. viii. p. 131 sqq.</sense></entryFree>

timavus: <entryFree id="n48356" type="main" key="Ti^ma_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭmāvus</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vos</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Istria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Aquileia and Trieste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:215" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 6, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:25:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
timefactus: <entryFree id="n48357" type="main" key="ti^me^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>timeo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n48357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made afraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frightened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimidated</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">timefactae religiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timefacta libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
timeo: <entryFree id="n48358" type="main" key="ti^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root tam-; Sanscr. tam-yati, to be stupefied; tamas, darkness; cf. temulentus</etym>, <sense id="n48358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be afraid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehend; to be afraid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehensive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">anxious;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48358.1" n="1" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: vereor, metuo, paveo): quamquam omnia sunt metuenda, nihil magis quam perfidiam timemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos aliquamdiu inermes timuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum Tantalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:981 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 981 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos casus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen atque imperium absentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numinis iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium pejus leto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta (amantes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternas poenas timendum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 111</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos esse timendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>; so, si ipse fulgor timeretur, <cb n="TIMI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Cn. Pompeius timeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>. — Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to have to fear</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be exposed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro telis gerit quae timuit et quae fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 40 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 40 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:793" default="NO">793</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 270" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 270</bibl></cit>. — With <case>dat.</case> of the object for which one fears something: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae causae nihil nos timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronum justitiae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furem caulibus aut pomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxiam vini aegris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 101</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de suo ac legionis periculo nihil timebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se nihil timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 1, 1</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid pro quoque timendum, aut a quoque timendum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: pro amicis omnia timui, pro me nihil. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4</bibl>, praef. § 15. — </sense><sense id="n48358.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">misera timeo, quid hoc sit negotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo, quid rerum gesserim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid possem, timebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc istic quid agatur, magnopere timeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">jam nunc timeo, quidnam ... pro exspectatione omnium eloqui possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misera timeo, incertum hoc quorsum accidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quo sint eruptura timeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc nostrae timeo parti, quid hic respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48358.3" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (freq. since the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): Caesar etsi timebat tantae magnitudinis flumini exercitum obicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites cum intrare fumum et flammam densissimam timerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:16" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timebant prisci truncum findere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jurare time,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19, 27</bibl>; 2, 1, 114; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 593</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 246</bibl>.— Rarely with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni cedenti instaturum alterum timuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48358.4" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">metuo et timeo, ne hoc tandem propalam fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo, ne malefacta mea sint inventa omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: haec timeo ne impediantur, D. Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque timerent, ne circumvenirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non times, ne locum perdas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timuit, ne non succederet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timere, ne non virtute hostium, sed lassitudine suā vincerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo, ut sustineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut satis commode supportari posset (res frumentaria), timere dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48358.5" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">fac, ego ne metuam igitur et ut tu meam timeas vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salva est navis, ne time,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ne time,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timentibus ceteris propter ignorationem locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">timentes confirmat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidie aliquid fit lenius quam timebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timere et admirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:86" default="NO">9, 2, 86</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publicā valde timeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo quidem genere ego numquam timui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 59</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pro eo timebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timentem pro capite amicissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis pericliter, plus tamen pro te timeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:20:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgentia pro suis timentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 9:26:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 26, 2</bibl></cit>, B: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pro illo nimium timet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eget divitiis timet pro illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 14:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">90, 43: pro Aristippi animā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timuere dei pro vindice terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 241</bibl></cit>.—Pregn., with <case>abl.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">timuit exterrita pennis Ales,</quote> <trans><tr>expressed its fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 505</bibl></cit>. — Freq. with <case>dat.</case> of the object for which one fears: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi timui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi timuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 729</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptui suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbi timetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 138</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 885" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 885</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n48358.6" n="6" level="3"> Timens like timidus, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis timentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1239</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
timescens: <entryFree id="n48359" type="hapax" key="ti^mescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <sense id="n48359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. inch.</hi> [timeo], <hi rend="ital">lecoming fearful of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athanaricus paria timescens abscessit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
timide: <entryFree id="n48360" type="main" key="ti^mi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. timidus <sense id="n48360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
timiditas: <entryFree id="n48361" type="main" key="ti^mi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>timidus</etym>, <sense id="n48361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fearfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cowardice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timidity</hi> (a favorite word of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">formido, timiditas, pavor, ignavia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 18, 52</bibl></cit>: ecfare, quae cor <cb n="TIMO" /> tuom timiditas territet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 228, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex rebus timiditas, non ex vocabulis nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4</bibl></cit>. 19, 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:41:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 41, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 74, 300</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>. — In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantae timiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
timidule: <entryFree id="n48362" type="hapax" key="ti^mi^du^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmĭdŭlē</orth>, <sense id="n48362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. dim.</hi> [timidus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat timidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reptare per balneas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
timidus: <entryFree id="n48363" type="main" key="ti^mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>timeo</etym>, <sense id="n48363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint-hearted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cowardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timid</hi> (opp. audax; cf.: pavidus, trepidus, iners, ignavus): timido metu refugere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 218</bibl>; id. ap. Fin. 5, 11, 31 (Trag. v. 46 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium me timidum fuisse confiteor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se timidum atque ignavum judicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidus ac tremens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbelles timidique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidus imperitusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidus in labore militari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non timidus ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 63</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">timidus animus, humilis, demissus fractusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit> (19), 172: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timido cursu Fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro cauto timidus accipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bello fortis, in foro timidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 120:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 120, 9</bibl></cit>.— In a good sense = cautus, <hi rend="ital">cautious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater timidi non solet flere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversis mediocribus timidiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:13" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil timidius columbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidiora mandata videbantur, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 18, 1</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidissime Phineu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba, columbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48363.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Codrus pro patriā non timidus mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non timidus pro patriā perire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitare aprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:575" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 575</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48363.2" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">timidus procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 100</bibl></cit>: animalia timida lucis, <hi rend="ital">that shun the light</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">remote from the light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 20:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 20, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidum doloris ac mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fearfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timide (opp. fidenter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timide aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timide vel potius verecunde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 29, 80</bibl>; Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 746</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 393" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 393</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnia trepidantius timidiusque ageret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod timidissime dicendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
timochares: <entryFree id="n48364" type="main" key="Ti_mo^cha^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīmŏchăres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a courtier of Pyrrhus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who proposed to Fabricius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill the king his master</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
timocrates: <entryFree id="n48365" type="main" key="Ti_mo^cra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīmŏcrătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*timokra/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Epicurean philosopher of the third century</hi> B. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
timoleon: <entryFree id="n48366" type="main" key="Ti_mo^le^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīmŏlĕon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*timole/wn,</foreign> <sense id="n48366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Corinthian general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose life was written by Nepos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīmŏ-lĕontēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from Timoleon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
timolus: <entryFree id="n48367" type="main" key="Ti^mo_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭmōlus</orth>, v. Tmolus.</entryFree>
timomachus: <entryFree id="n48368" type="main" key="Ti_mo^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīmŏmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*timo/maxos,</foreign> <sense id="n48368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eminent painter of Byzantium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the time of Julius Cæsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 38, 39, § 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 121 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
timon: <entryFree id="n48369" type="main" key="Ti_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīmon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ti/mwn,</foreign> <sense id="n48369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated misanthrope of Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 25</bibl> and 27.</sense></entryFree>
timor: <entryFree id="n48370" type="main" key="ti^mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmos</orth>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 6</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>timeo</etym>. <sense id="n48370.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">metus, horror, formido, timiditas, pavor): definiunt timorem metum mali appropinquantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus ac timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor praepedit dicta linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore torpeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae timore in genua concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in timorem dabo militarem advenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus timore Obstipuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno timore sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruciatu timoris angi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: amici nostri, timore de nobis <pb n="1873" /> <cb n="TINE" /> afficiuntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res quae mihi facit timorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore perterritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 28, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc accedit summus timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt in judicum animis ... oratione molienda, amor, odium ... spes, laetitia, timor, molestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor incutitur ex ipsorum periculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 51, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor omnem exercitum occupavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthis timor injectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui timorem deicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc mihi timorem eripe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ades animo et omitte timorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timorem abicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore sublato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: omni timore deposito, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut se ex maximo timore colligerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (aestas), quae sequitur, magno est in timore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>occasions great apprehension</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam fidele consilium daturus timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:26:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 26, 5</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi timor est, ne auctumnalis satio hiemis gelicidiis peruratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 8</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in timore civitas fuit, obsides captivosque Poenorum ea moliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 26, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subest ille timor ne dignitatem quidem posse retineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 334</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum major a Romanis metus timorem a principibus suis vicisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the thing feared: <cit><quote lang="la">belli magni timor impendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vituperationis non injustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 4</bibl></cit>, : <cit><quote lang="la">repentinae incursionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 604</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48370.1" n="B" level="2"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">Fear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 719</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48370.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n48370.3" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">awe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veneration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod hominibus perturbatis inanem religionem timoremque dejecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:31" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus in orbe deos fecit timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:661" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48370.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An object that excites fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a terror</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaci tu timor esse potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit> (4, 6, 70): <cit><quote lang="la">Cacus Aventinae timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:551" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 551</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 291</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 612</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus uterque timor latronibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 119</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48370.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An object for which anxiety is felt</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ratis, tot gracili ligno complexa timores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:80" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
timoratus: <entryFree id="n48371" type="main" key="ti^mo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭmōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>timor</etym>, <sense id="n48371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of reverence towards God</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 25</bibl> (transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">eu)labh/s</foreign>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 14, 50, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
timotheus: <entryFree id="n48372" type="main" key="Ti_mo^the^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīmŏthĕus</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*timo/qeos.</foreign> <sense id="n48372.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Conon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader of the Athenians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and restorer of the walls of Athens;</hi> his life is written by Nepos; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n48372.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A musician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Miletus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tina: <entryFree id="n48373" type="hapax" key="ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine-vessel</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 544, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tinia vasa vinaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=365" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 365</bibl></cit> Müll.; and: canava, cavea, tinum, Not. Tir.</sense></entryFree>
tinca: <entryFree id="n48374" type="main" key="tinca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small fish</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the tench</hi>: Cyprinus tinca, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tincta: <entryFree id="n48375" type="main" key="tincta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tincta</orth>, v. tingo <sense id="n48375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tinctilis: <entryFree id="n48376" type="hapax" key="tincti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinctĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tingo</etym>, <sense id="n48376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in which something is dipped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucri ferro tinctile virus inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tinctor: <entryFree id="n48377" type="gloss" key="tinctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyer</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Papir. Dipl. 251; cf.: tinctor, <foreign lang="greek">bafeu/s,</foreign> Gloss. (but not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>, where tectores is the true reading).</sense></entryFree>
tinctorius: <entryFree id="n48378" type="hapax" key="tincto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinctōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to plunging in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dyeing;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bloodthirsty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 7, 5, § 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tinctura: <entryFree id="n48379" type="main" key="tinctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyeing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 38, § 119</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tinctus: <entryFree id="n48380" type="main" key="tinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tingo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48381" type="hapax" key="tinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tingo</etym>, <sense id="n48381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dipping into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dyeing;</hi> meton., <hi rend="ital">a sauce</hi> into which something is dipped: <cit><quote lang="la">avis croceo tinctu cibis gratissima,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>saffron-sauce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tinea: <entryFree id="n48382" type="main" key="ti^ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tan-, root of tondeo; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/mnw</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n48382.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a gnawing worm</hi>, in <cb n="TINN" /> clothes, books, etc., <hi rend="ital">a moth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bookworm</hi>, etc.: Phalaena tinea, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 98, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 35, 41, § 117</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48382.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48382.2" n="A" level="2"> Of the <hi rend="ital">moth</hi> that flutters about a light, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Phoen. 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48382.3" n="B" level="2"> Of the <hi rend="ital">wood-worm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48382.4" n="C" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">worms</hi> in beehives, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48382.5" n="D" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">worms</hi> in fig-trees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48382.6" n="E" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">worms</hi> in the human body, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 120, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:140" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20, 83, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:148" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 77, § 148</bibl>; 24, 10, 47, § 77.—</sense><sense id="n48382.7" n="F" level="1"> Agrestes tineae, <hi rend="ital">silkworms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 373</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48382.8" n="G" level="1"> Of <hi rend="ital">lice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 260</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tineo: <entryFree id="n48383" type="main" key="ti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>tinea</etym>, <sense id="n48383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be infested by moths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,050:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Bar. 6, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tineola: <entryFree id="n48384" type="hapax" key="ti^ne^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭnĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little worm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tineosus: <entryFree id="n48385" type="hapax" key="ti^ne^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭnĕōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of worms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wormy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tinge: <entryFree id="n48386" type="main" key="Tinge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tingē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tingi</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Mauritania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tangiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tingĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Tingi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Gen. Max. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tingo: <entryFree id="n48387" type="main" key="tingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tingo</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tinguo</orth>), <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root tvak-, to wet; Sanscr. tuc-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/ggw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n48387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bathe</hi> with or in any liquid (class.; cf.: aspergo, irroro, imbuo). </sense><sense id="n48387.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica sanguine centauri tincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydia Pactoli tingit arata liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amne comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">tinget pavimentum mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arctos Oceani metuentis aequore tingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridentia Aera lacu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmam lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in undis summa pedum vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:343" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedis vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:592" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 592</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumine corpora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bathe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:413" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora lymphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:459" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amne faces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(asinae) horrent ita ut pedes omnino caveant tingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: in alto Phoebus anhelos Aequore tinget equos, <hi rend="ital">bathe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plunge</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will set</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego te meis Immunem meditor tingere poculis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to entertain</tr>, <tr>treat you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48387.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48387.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To soak in color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge</hi> (syn. inficio): <cit><quote lang="la">Phocaico bibulas tingebat murice lanas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lanas vestium murice Afro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 36</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">niveam ovem Tyrio murice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma viridi cortice tincta nucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes Gaetulo murice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem rubro cocco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine cultros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 599</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">secures cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to paint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:77:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 77, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tinguntur sole populi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are embrowned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 70</bibl></cit>: nummos, <hi rend="ital">to wash copper coins with gold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">silver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">globus ... candenti lumine tinctus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>illuminated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 720</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">loca lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48387.4" n="2" level="3"> Of colors as objects, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 201</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:77" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 18, 31, § 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48387.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To baptize</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tinctus est ab Joanne prophetā in Jordane flumine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48387.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: orator sit mihi tinctus litteris, audierit aliquid, legerit, <hi rend="ital">tinctured</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">imbued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well furnished with</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laelia patris elegantiā tincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:211" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba sensu tincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romano lepidos sale tinge libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sales lepore Attico tincti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:20:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in similitudinem sui tingit (virtus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48387.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tingens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tingentium officinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48387.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tincta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">dyed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">colored stuffs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tincta absint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tiniaria: <entryFree id="n48388" type="main" key="ti^ni^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭnĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tinea</etym>, <sense id="n48388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mothmullein</hi>: Teucrium polium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 83" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tinnimentum: <entryFree id="n48389" type="hapax" key="tinni_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinnīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tinnio</etym>, <sense id="n48389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tingling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quidem edepol tinnimentum est auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tinnio: <entryFree id="n48390" type="main" key="tinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinnĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tīnĭo</orth>), <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n48390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root tan-; cf.: tono, tonitru], <hi rend="ital">to ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jingle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tingle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48390.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tinniit tintinnabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 162</bibl></cit>: tinnit hastilibus umbo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 432 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">apes tinniendo aere perterritas perducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 30</bibl></cit>: (Graeci) <hi rend="ital">n</hi> (litteram) jucundam et in fine praecipue quasi tinnientem illius <cb n="TIPP" /> (<hi rend="ital">m</hi> litterae) loco ponunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 31</bibl> (cf. retinnit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 171</bibl>): nec tibi dubito in foro diu tinnisse auriculas, <hi rend="ital">have tingled</hi>, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 5</bibl> Mai; cf. tinnitus.—</sense><sense id="n48390.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48390.3" n="A" level="2"> Colloq., <hi rend="ital">to clink</hi> money, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspecto maxime, ecquid Dolabella tinniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: veri speciem dignoscere calles, Nequa subaerato mendosum tinniat auro,</quote> <trans><tr>ring false</tr>, <tr>give a false sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:105" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48390.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To have a sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shrill voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sing</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">comprime te: nimium tinnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 99</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tinnire canorā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid se tinniturum promisit,</quote> <trans><tr>to sing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere novo, cum jam tinnire volucres Incipient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:16" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tinnito: <entryFree id="n48391" type="main" key="tinni^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinnĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n48391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [tinnio], <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parus enim quamvis per noctem tinnitet omnem, Auct. Carm. de Philom. 9 (al. tinniat): in trivio tinnitare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to boast in public</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Fratr. 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tinnitus: <entryFree id="n48392" type="main" key="tinni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinnītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jingling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tingling</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n48392.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tinnitusque cie et Matris quate cymbala circum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepit assiduo Tinnitu galea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 809</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonuit tinnitibus ensis acutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 204</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 589</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 536</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera tinnitus repulsa dabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:184" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:146" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tinnitum aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:35:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 35, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuminum silvestre auribus instillatur ad sonitus atque tinnitus,</quote> <trans><tr>a ringing in the ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 15, 57, § 162</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:85" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 42, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 5, § 24</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n48392.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of language, <hi rend="ital">a jingling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jingle</hi> of words: <cit><quote lang="la">tinnitus Gallionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl></cit>; cf. tinnulus, II.</sense></entryFree>
tinnulus: <entryFree id="n48393" type="main" key="tinnu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinnŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinkling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill-sounding</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n48393.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chordae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 833" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:74" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 13</bibl></cit>; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (with tenuis): <cit><quote lang="la">illic cymbala tinnulaeque Gades,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the shrill noise of the Gaditan maidens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:71" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 71</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 162</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n48393.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of speakers: <cit><quote lang="la">(rhetores) tumidi et corrupti et tinnuli,</quote> <trans><tr>jingling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 143, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. tinnitus, II.</sense></entryFree>
tinnunculus: <entryFree id="n48394" type="main" key="tinnunculus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tinnunculus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hawk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the kestrel</hi>: Falco tinnunculus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 37, 52, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tintinnabulatus: <entryFree id="n48395" type="hapax" key="tintinna_bu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tintinnābŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tintinnabulum</etym>, <sense id="n48395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wearing a bell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bells</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tintinnabulum: <entryFree id="n48396" type="main" key="tintinna_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tintinnābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tintinno</etym>, <sense id="n48396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signal-bell</hi>, e. g. on a door to summon the attendant, on the necks of cattle, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:441" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 441</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:163" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 163</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 336</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tintinnaculus: <entryFree id="n48397" type="hapax" key="tintinna_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tintinnācŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tinkling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clanking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">educi ad tintinnaculos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to the manacled malefactors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit> Spengel ad loc. (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the executioners</hi> who fastened the chains).</sense></entryFree>
tintinnio: <entryFree id="n48398" type="main" key="tintinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tintinnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. tintinno.</entryFree>
tintinno: <entryFree id="n48399" type="main" key="tintinno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tintinno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tintĭno</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">tintin-nĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>reduplicated from tinnio</etym>, <sense id="n48399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to jingle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tingle</hi> (anteclass.): tintinnabant compedes, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=364" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 364</bibl> Müll.; Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 16</bibl>: tintinnire janitoris impedimenta (i. e. catenas) audio, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 14</bibl>; id. ap<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=364" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 364</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitu suopte Tintĭnant aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:51:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 51, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tintinnum: <entryFree id="n48400" type="hapax" key="tintinnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tintinnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tintinno</etym>, <sense id="n48400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jingling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinkling</hi>, Ven. Carm. 2, 20, 49.</sense></entryFree>
tintino: <entryFree id="n48401" type="hapax" key="tinti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tintĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. tintinno.</entryFree>
tinus: <entryFree id="n48402" type="main" key="ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>: Viburnum tinus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:60" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 10, 11, § 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacis caerula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
