tiphe: <entryFree id="n48403" type="greek" key="tiphe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tiphē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ti/fh,</foreign> <sense id="n48403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grain</hi>, acc. to Sprengel, <hi rend="ital">Peter</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one-grained wheat</hi>: Triticum monococcon, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:93" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 10, 20, § 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tiphyon: <entryFree id="n48404" type="greek" key="tiphy^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tiphyon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ti/fuon,</foreign> <sense id="n48404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of narcissus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 67</bibl> (dub.; Jahn, iphyon).</sense></entryFree>
tiphys: <entryFree id="n48405" type="main" key="Ti_phys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīphys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype> (<case>voc.</case> Tiphy), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ti=fus,</foreign> <sense id="n48405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pilot of the Argo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 4, 37</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 243</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
tippula: <entryFree id="n48406" type="main" key="tippu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tippŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tip-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an insect that</hi> <pb n="1874" /> <cb n="TIRU" /> <hi rend="ital">runs swiftly over the water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the water-spider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water - spinner</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 180, 11</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any very light object: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tippulai leonis pondu'st quam fides lenonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
tirenuspons: <entryFree id="n48407" type="main" key="Tire_nus pons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tirēnus pons</orth>, <sense id="n48407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bridge at Minturnæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tiresias: <entryFree id="n48408" type="main" key="Ti_re^si^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīrĕsĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*teiresi/as.</foreign> <sense id="n48408.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated blind soothsayer of Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 68" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:75" default="NO">75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 40, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 323</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:589" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 589</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48408.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">a blind man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:249" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 249</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tiridates: <entryFree id="n48409" type="main" key="Ti_ri^da_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīrĭdātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several kings of Armenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 39, 40, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 2, 6, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tiro: <entryFree id="n48410" type="main" key="ti_ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tīro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; in milit. lang., <sense id="n48410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a newly-levied soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a young soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recruit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48410.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas tironum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio tironum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 31, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaque tironi non patienda feret (opp. vetus miles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 566</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in appos. like an <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">tirones milites (opp. veterani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles, Auct. B. Afr. 16, 1: exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:14" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 43, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48410.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a beginner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tiro</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā in re tiro ac rudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae rudis et tiro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo non aetate sed usu forensi atque exercitatione tiro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scholis exercitati, tirones in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: deductus in forum tiro, <hi rend="ital">as a young man</hi>, after putting on the toga virilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:787" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 787</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tirones gladiatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, adject.: tirones gladiatores, Auct. B. Afr. 71, 1.—Of animals: ut tironem (bovem) cum veterano adjungant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48411" type="main" key="Ti_ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> So esp., M. Tullius Tiro, <hi rend="ital">the learned freedman of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 17, 2</bibl> (to him are addressed the letters <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 3</bibl>-10; 16, 12-15); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9:1" default="NO">13, 9, 1</bibl> sq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīrōnĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tiro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tironiana cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tirocinium: <entryFree id="n48412" type="main" key="ti_ro_ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tīrōcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tiro</etym>. <sense id="n48412.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48412.1" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">the first military service</hi> or <hi rend="ital">first campaign of a young soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">military rawness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inexperience</hi>, = rudimentum (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter exercitūs paucitatem et tirocinium, Auct. B. Afr. 31, 6: aetatis infirmitas aut militiae tirocinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tirocinii rudimenta deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non solum tirocinia, verum et incunabula in ipsis castris posuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48412.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the young troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raw forces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recruits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptum tirocinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 35, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48412.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the first beginning</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">the first trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">essay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in L. Paulo accusando tirocinium ponere et documentum eloquentiae dare voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 37, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec differendum est tirocinium in senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">tirocinii metum transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: filios suo quemque tirocinio deducere in forum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">after putting on the</hi> toga virilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies tirocinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam sumpsit barbamque posuit, sine ullo honore, qualis contigerat tirocinio fratrum ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 10</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>their first voyage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 26, § 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48412.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inexperience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus cum simul et tirocinio et perturbatione juvenis moveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tirocinio peccet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 189</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tironatus: <entryFree id="n48413" type="main" key="ti_ro_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tīrōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition of a recruit</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 7, 13, 21.</sense></entryFree>
tironianus: <entryFree id="n48414" type="main" key="Ti_ro_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīrōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Tiro.</entryFree>
tiruncula: <entryFree id="n48415" type="main" key="ti_runcu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tīruncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. tirunculus.</entryFree>
tirunculus: <entryFree id="n48416" type="main" key="ti_runcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tīruncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tiro</etym>, <sense id="n48416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young beginner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little tiro</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut probarem tibi, quam vehementes haberent tirunculi impetus primos ad optima quaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitia sic tirunculum (vilicum) contemnunt ut senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me quamquam tirunculum sollicitavit ad Emendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cb n="TITA" /> nec frustum capreae Novit noster tirunculus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 143</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In apposition: miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tīruncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a female beginner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluta Blaesillam et Eustochium, tirunculas nostras,</quote> <trans><tr>female pupils</tr>, <tr>novices</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 31, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a bitch</hi> that has littered for the first time, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tiryns: <entryFree id="n48417" type="main" key="Ti_ryns"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīryns</orth>, <itype>nthis or nthos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ti/runs,</foreign> <sense id="n48417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town in Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Hercules was brought up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:147" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 662</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīrynthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tiryns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tirynthian;</hi> and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, also, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Herculean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 410</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:349" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 349</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:547" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tirynthius heros,</quote> <trans><tr>Chromis</tr>, <tr>the son of Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:489" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 489</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">Q. Fabius Maximus</hi> (because the Fabii deduced their origin from Hercules), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:218" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 218</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius, Tirynthia proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens, i. e. Fabia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <trans><tr>troops of Tiryns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans><tr>of Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the conception of Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Herculaneum</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 109</bibl></cit>; cf. tecta, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Saguntum</hi>, built by Hercules, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:300" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 300</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48417.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48417.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīrynthĭus</orth>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 268</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 564</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:629" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 629</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 662</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 228</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48417.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīrynthĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Alcmena</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mother of Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 112</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48417.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīrynthĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of Tiryns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tis: <entryFree id="n48418" type="main" key="tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tis</orth>, i. e. tui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 42</bibl>; v. tu.</entryFree>
tisaeus: <entryFree id="n48419" type="main" key="Ti_saeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīsaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīsaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tisai=on,</foreign> <sense id="n48419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Thessaly</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bardjora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tisagoras: <entryFree id="n48420" type="main" key="Ti_sa^go^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīsăgŏras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tisago/ras,</foreign> <sense id="n48420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brother of Miltiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tisamenus: <entryFree id="n48421" type="main" key="Ti_sa^me^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīsămĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tisameno/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Orestes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and king of Argos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:346" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 124" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tisanusa: <entryFree id="n48422" type="main" key="Tisanu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tisanūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town and harbor of Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tisias: <entryFree id="n48423" type="main" key="Ti_si^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīsĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tisi/as,</foreign> <sense id="n48423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Sicilian who wrote on oratory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:8" default="NO">3, 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tisicrates: <entryFree id="n48424" type="main" key="Ti_sicra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīsicrătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tisikra/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor of Sicyon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of the painter Arcesilas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:146" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tisiphone: <entryFree id="n48425" type="main" key="Ti_si^pho^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīsĭphŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tisifo/nh</foreign> (avenger of murder), <sense id="n48425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Furies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 571</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 761</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl> (4, 4), 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 481</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 984" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 984</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīsĭ-phŏnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tisiphone Tisiphonean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deserving of punishment</tr>, <tr>guilty</tr>, <tr>criminal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:9:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tisse: <entryFree id="n48426" type="main" key="Tisse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tissē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little town in Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Randazzo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:267" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 267</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tis-senses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tisse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:38:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 38, § 86</bibl>; for which: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tis-sinenses</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
titan: <entryFree id="n48427" type="main" key="Ti_tan"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītan</orth>, <itype>ānis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n48427.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tita/n.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n48427.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Cœlus and Vesta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elder brother of Saturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and ancestor of the Titans</hi>, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītāni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītānes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">who contended with Saturn for the sovereignty of heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and were</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the thunderbolts of his son Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitated into Tartarus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi Titani cum dis belligerem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> Titanis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> genus Titanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl>: Titanum suboles, id. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 23.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Titanas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:797" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 797</bibl>.—Appellatively: Titanus, of <hi rend="ital">an old man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48427.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A grandson of the above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Hyperion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Sun-god</hi>, i. q. Sol, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 60</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 438</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:617" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 617</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 180</bibl>; 4, 919 al. —</sense><sense id="n48427.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prometheus</hi>, as grandson of Titan, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 35</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n48427.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Titan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the Titans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Titanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes, Fulmine dejecti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Titans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Titans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:725" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:91" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 91</bibl></cit>: ales, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Phœnix</hi>, as sacred to the sun (Titan, B.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 1, 7</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital"> Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītā-nĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for Titan, B., <hi rend="ital">the Sun-god</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 127</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītānĭa</orth>, ae. </sense><sense id="n48427.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Latona</hi>, as daughter of the Titan Cœus, <cb n="TITI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 346</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48427.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pyrrha</hi>, as descendant of the Titan Prometheus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 395</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48427.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, as sister of Sol, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 173</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48427.8" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Circe</hi>, as daughter of <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> Ov. M. 14, 382</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 438</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48427.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītānĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Titan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the Titans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Titanic</hi>: dracones, <hi rend="ital">sprung from the Titans</hi>' <hi rend="ital">blood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 398</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48427.10" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītānis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Titanic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Titans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:132" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circe, as daughter of Sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:968" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 968</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 376</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:212" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 212</bibl>.— Also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītānis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Circe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48427.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 16</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 317 Vahl.); and of <hi rend="ital">Tethys</hi>, as sister of Sol, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:81" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
titanomachia: <entryFree id="n48428" type="main" key="Ti_ta_no^ma^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītānŏmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*titanomaxi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the battle with the Titans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 150" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 150</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
titarisos: <entryFree id="n48429" type="main" key="Titari_sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Titarīsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 376</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tithoes: <entryFree id="n48430" type="main" key="Tithoes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tithoës</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">builder of the labyrinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tithonus: <entryFree id="n48431" type="main" key="Ti_tho_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīthōnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-nos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tiqwno/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Laomedon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consort of Aurora</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Memnon; endowed with immortality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and changed at last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after reaching a decrepit old age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into a cicada</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 585</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:473" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 28, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tithoni conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17</bibl></cit> (18), 111.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48431.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīthōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tithonus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tithonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Aurora</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:403" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 403</bibl></cit>.—Called also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīthōnia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:943" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 943</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:311" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 311</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:1" default="NO">3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:3" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 3, 151</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48431.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīthōnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tithonus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 368</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48431.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīthōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Tithonus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Aurora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tithymalis: <entryFree id="n48432" type="main" key="ti^thy^ma^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭthymălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <sense id="n48432.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
tithymalus: <entryFree id="n48433" type="greek" key="ti^thy^ma^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭthymălus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tĭthymallus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tiqu/malos,</foreign> <sense id="n48433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant with a milklike sap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurge</hi> (Euphorbia, Linn.), of many species, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 39, § 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 46, 841</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64, 1106</bibl>.—A female species, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭthymălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">sea-spurge</hi>: Euphorbia paralias, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 41, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
titianus: <entryFree id="n48434" type="main" key="Ti^ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Titius, II. B.</entryFree>
titienses: <entryFree id="n48435" type="main" key="Ti^ti^enses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. Titius, II. C.</entryFree>
titiens: <entryFree id="n48436" type="main" key="Ti^ti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭens</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. Titius, II. C. <sense id="n48436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
titillamentum: <entryFree id="n48437" type="hapax" key="ti_tilla_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tītillāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>titillo</etym>, <sense id="n48437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tickling</hi>, for titillatio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
titillatio: <entryFree id="n48438" type="main" key="ti_tilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tītillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tickling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">titillation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates, quibus quasi titillatic sensibus adhibetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est voluptatum tanta quasi titillatio in senibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
titillatus: <entryFree id="n48439" type="main" key="ti_tilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tītillātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tickling</hi>, for titillatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:6:26" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:11:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 11, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
titillo: <entryFree id="n48440" type="main" key="ti_tillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tītillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">titillate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48440.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas, quae quasi titillaret sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">carnem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinis levitatem voluptate quasi titillantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 63</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48440.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vos titillet gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appetentia cum titillatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">titillata voluptas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 108, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina nulla prorsus invidia titillata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his blandimentis titillat animas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 102:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 102, 5</bibl>, Serm. 154, 4; Leo. M. Serm. 41, 1.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego titillare non desinam,</quote> <trans><tr>to amuse myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per diem noctemque titillari velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">titillante gulā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
titillus: <entryFree id="n48441" type="hapax" key="ti_tillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tītillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>titillo</etym>, <sense id="n48441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tickling</hi>, for titillatio, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 2.</sense></entryFree>
titinius: <entryFree id="n48442" type="main" key="Ti^ti^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭnĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtinnĭus</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman comic poet of the ante-class. period;</hi> see the fragments of his writings in Com. Rel. pp. 115-137 Rib.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 215</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
titio: <entryFree id="n48443" type="main" key="ti^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning brand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firebrand</hi> (syn.: taeda, fax), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 182, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">302, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 171 al" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 171 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">titionem vulgus appellat extractum foco torrem semiustum et exstinctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
titius: <entryFree id="n48444" type="main" key="Ti^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; e. g. Sex. Titius, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose motions so much resembled dancing that a certain dance was named</hi> Titius <hi rend="ital">after him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:225" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 225</bibl>; <pb n="1875" /> <cb n="TITU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48444.1" n="II" level="1"> Titius Septimius, to whom is addressed <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 1</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48444.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Titius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Titian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodales,</quote> <trans><tr>appointed for the Sabine worship by king Titus Tatius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=85" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 85</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 602</bibl>.—Called also TITIALES, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2432</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also SODALIS TITIENSIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 299</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48444.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭ-tĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Titius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Titian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:50" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:85" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48444.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to king Titus Tatius;</hi> v. sodalis, A. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for the usual Tatienses, <hi rend="ital">one of the three Roman equestrian centuries;</hi> v. Tatius; also abbrev. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtĭens</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 31.</sense></entryFree>
